Epic Encounters detected!
Ensure that it is activated in the Mods menu. Good luck and thanks for playing!
Attacking guards in a city is one of the funniest ways to kill people.
Drain Willpower Skillbook

[1] allows you to perform melee Attacks of Opportunity against attackers that miss you, or whom you block. Also, you no longer suffer a defense penalty when flanked.
You cannot retaliate against attackers who are out of your reach.

[1] causes your Rot damage to apply Delerium, the effects of which increase with your Tenebrium skill. Additionally, grants immunity to Mute.

Tenebrium 4: -2 Initiative.
Tenebrium 5: 15% chance to Curse.
Tenebrium 6: Curse chance to 30%.
Tenebrium 7: Curse chance to 45%.
Tenebrium 8: -1 Willpower.
Tenebrium 9: Initiative to -4, and -3 AP Recovery.

Each level also conveys the effects of previous levels.
Revisit every skill! Epic Encounters reworks the original skills, so give those subpar spells another chance and see if they can't catch your fancy.
Be careful when saving up Chain bonus- if you miss an attack, you'll lose two stacks, and if you aren't invisible or sneaking when your turn starts, you'll lose it all!
[1] grants +20 Defense rating. Additionally, you gain a [2]% Blocking Chance while dual wielding.

[1] improves your armour rating, decreases movement penalties from equipment worn, increases your Poison Resistance, and improves your maximum resistances.
Each level grants +3 armour rating, +1% to all maximum resistances, +5% to Poison Resistance, and reduces movement penalty by 20%. Movement penalty cannot be reduced past 100%, but for levels beyond 5th, an extra +1% to all maximum resistances is awarded.

Sneaking ability improves your movement speed while sneaking, shrinks NPC sight cones, and increases the power of backstabs. Every level of Sneaking past 2 increases your backstab multiplier by 0.3.

Pickpocketing allows you to pickpocket more intelligent and perceptive characters. Additionally, it determines the weight and value that can be stolen.

Lockpicking influences the complexity of locks you can pick, and the speed at which you can do it.
Telekinesis
We hope you enjoy experiencing Epic Encounters at least as much as we enjoyed creating it. :)
[1] gives you [2]% x Soldier extra Vitality. Additionally, grants <font color="00ffff">immunity to Petrification</font> at Soldier 5.
Epic Encounters reworks Charisma into the new ability, Bard. With its awesome new reactions you don't have to feel bad about picking it to win arguments anymore!

[1] grants the ability to detect invisible or sneaking enemies at the start and end of your turn. Also gives you a +[2] Perception bonus for detecting traps and secrets.

Your Perception score determines how far away you can spot hidden enemies, and how likely you are to spot them. It becomes more difficult to spot targets that are further away, as well those that are stealthy or hidden with powerful magic. Blindness radically lowers the chance of revealing enemies.

2m range for each point of Perception above 5, maximum of 20m.
[1] grants +5% Critical Chance. Additionally, your grenade throws will never miss again.
Relentless
Level [1]: Boosts Initiative by 5, Damage by 5%, Chance to hit by 10% and Critical Chance by 3%.

In Epic Encounters, wielding a dagger allows a character to build Chain from striking enemies; you can gain two per turn and up to five total. Save up your Chain to use with Chain Finishers for powerful bonus effects!
Level [1]: Boosts Initiative by 12, Damage by 15%, Chance to hit by 15%, Critical Chance by 5%, Armour Rating by 16, Grants Immunity to Fear, and adds +1 to Willpower and Grit.
[1] grants you 1 additional point of Strength and doubles the amount of weight you can carry. Additionally, grants <font color="00ffff">immunity to Weak</font> with Soldier 5.
Level [1]: Boosts damage and chance to hit by 5%.
To examine a character, hover over them and hit [IE_ToggleInfo]. The higher your Metamind skill, the more detailed the info you get.

The higher your Metamind score, the heavier the items you can telepathically lift, and the farther you can move them. Additionally, more information about enemies is revealed to you with a greater Metamind level.

To identify, use an Identifying Glass on the item you want to identify.

No one has more friends than the man with many Metamind points!
Epic Encounters groups Loremaster and Telekinesis into this single ability so you can grab stuff from a distance while you check stuff from a distance.
[1] improves your saving throws against effects which directly assault the body, or test your physical wellness and perseverance.
[1] allows a character to backstab with daggers, knives, rondels and rapiers. Higher Sneaking can increase the damage of your backstabs.

You or the merchant will need enough points in <font color="70b10e">Lore Master</font> to do so.
Keep your eyes sharp in those shiny new environs- you might find some hidden loot!
Diversify your disables! Epic Encounters imposes a two for every five turns limit on most effects that completely disable an enemy.
To the favored ones; to my friends: Facepalm, In and Out, Sleep, I am Disappoint--thanks for the memories.

Perception is great! In Epic Encounters Perception has been greatly improved, and is essential for any character hoping to score critical strikes.
You can even add on the Hyperacuity talent to detect hidden enemies!

4, 8, 12, 17, 22, 28, 34, 40.
Arrows will inflict an additional 20% of their damage as bonus elemental damage depending on the surface your target is standing in.
If you've been blinded, try to keep track of where everyone is before your turn. In Epic Encounters, blind characters have a difficult time seeing things.
During your turn, [1] consumes blood that you are standing in, healing you for 5% of your maximum vitality.
In Epic Encounters your resistances are limited to 75%, but some powerful effects can allow you to surpass this limit.

[1] improves your effectiveness with Poison damage, based on your Crafting score. Additionally, you can throw grenades [2] meters farther.

Crafting 2: Once per round, your Poison damage can add one stack of Untreated Poison.
Crafting 3: You may stack Untreated Poison up to 4.
Crafting 4: If a target has no Untreated Poison stacks, your Poison damage applies one.
Crafting 5: You may stack Untreated Poison up to 5.
Crafting 6: If a target has less than Untreated Poison II, your Poison damage applies it.
Crafting 7: You may stack Untreated Poison up to 6.
Crafting 8: If a target has less than Untreated Poison III, your Poison damage applies it.
Crafting 9: Your Poison damage can add a stack of Untreated Poison up to 3 times each round.

Zombies are immune to Untreated Poison.

Today a Wizard, tomorrow a Battlemage: Your starting stats don't have to determine the rest of your game. In Epic Encounters, you start with one respecialization point, and you can buy more from vendors- so don't be afraid to try new things!

[1] determines your luck in finding extra treasure, improves your Offence Rating by 3, Critical Chance by 1%, and gives you a chance to gain random benefits in combat.
At the start of each turn in combat, you have a chance to gain a random benefit. The chance of gaining an effect and the strength of the effect increase with a higher [1] score.

Level 1: 30%.
Level 2: 60%.
Level 3: 90%, 10% are strong.
Level 4: 100%, 30% are strong.
Level 5: 100%, 60% are strong.
Level 6: 100%, 60% are strong, 30% are exceptional.
Level 7: 100%, 40% are strong, 60% are exceptional.
Level 8: 100% chance for exceptional effect.

Levels 9 and beyond grant a 30% chance to grant additional exceptional effect(s).

You may only perform one of these actions at a time.

Demon reactions are performed against enemies within 20m who become Slowed, Cursed, or Weakened, dealing fire damage, Burning, and Poisoning.
Angel reactions are performed on allies within 20m who become Hastened, Blessed, or Fortified, healing 7% maximum vitality plus 2% per Intelligence beyond 10 and removing Burning and Weakened.

Many new skills have been added with Epic Encounters.
If you find a weird looking skillbook, it probably requires more than one ability to learn, but is well worth the investment.

[1] gives you +[2]% Elemental Resistance and +1% maximum Elemental Resistance per point in Soldier.

Empowered skills are improved variants of existing skills that can only appear on equipment.
You can always see which part of the skill is altered by looking for colored text on the skill card.

[1] determines the first impression you make on other people and your talent for Charming, Intimidating, and Reasoning. In combat, you may perform Bardic reactions to various situations when it is not your turn.
The amount of Bardic reactions you can make each round, as well as the power and variety of those reactions, depends on your [1] score.
You start combat with no reactions, but recover up to 2 at the start of your turn, storing those that go unused.
Every level of Bard that does not improve the power of your reactions increases your maximum stored reaction amount by 1.
At 4th and 7th level, your Bardic reactions improve.

First Tier Triggers: An ally misses an attack, becomes Burning, becomes Frozen, becomes Stunned, or becomes Petrified. An enemy scores a critical hit, or becomes Hasted.
Second Tier Triggers: An ally slips on ice, becomes Feared, becomes Slowed, or blocks an attack. An enemy blocks an attack.
Third Tier Triggers: An ally becomes Charmed or loses Invisibility or Sneaking out of turn.
Tricks of the Trade governs the three roguish abilities of Sneaking, Lockpicking, and Pickpocketing.
